title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil feels unfairly criticised, says agent Erkut Sogut | Metro News
text:
Sutton – FA Cup (A) – Mon 20 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr Crystal Palace (A) – Sat 8 Apr 
‘In these games people usually target a player who cost a lot of money and earns a lot of money – that is Mesut. But he can’t be always be the scapegoat. That’s not fair. 
‘Football is a team sport and Arsenal are not performing well as a team. Eleven players were on the pitch but Mesut was singled out for criticism. Was he the reason that Arsenal conceded five goals?’ Ozil has struggled to help Arsenal through a rough patch (Picture: Getty) 
His representative added that it almost feels like people want Ozil to fail with the way they focus on him more than other players before a ball has even been kicked. 
‘It started before the match, throughout the week leading up to the game. People started discussing: “Should he play? Should he be dropped?”. 
“It was as if everyone knew Arsenal would not make it through and we needed a scapegoat. This is not right. You win as a team and you lose as a team.’
